intro: Scabiosa olivieri var. longinvolucra, commonly known as the long-involucrate scabious, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its clusters of small, pink or purple flowers. The plant features a compact growth habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically arranged in dense, spherical inflorescences called involucres, which give it its common name. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive blooms and drought tolerance.
